solution_line_template: The 3 pigs that are sold after 12 months will cost the farmer {months_12}*{feed_cost_per_month}*{pigs_sold_12} = $<<{months_12}*{feed_cost_per_month}*{pigs_sold_12}={food_cost_12}>>{food_cost_12} in food costs.

The 3 pigs that are sold after 16 months will cost the farmer {months_16}*{feed_cost_per_month}*{pigs_sold_16} = $<<{months_16}*{feed_cost_per_month}*{pigs_sold_16}={food_cost_16}>>{food_cost_16} in food costs.
Thus, the total food cost to raise the 6 piglets was {food_cost_12} + {food_cost_16} = $<<{food_cost_12}+{food_cost_16}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost}.
Next, selling the 6 fully grown pigs will earn the farmer {total_pigs}*{sale_price_per_pig} = $<<{total_pigs}*{sale_price_per_pig}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue} in revenue.
Therefore, the earn the farmer {total_revenue} - {total_food_cost} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_food_cost}={profit}>>{profit} in profit from these sales.
